description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level, beneath the Red Line. Home to fish-men and merfolk, protected by a massive bubble.

keyEvents.title: Sanji Petrifies Upon Seeing Shirahoshi
keyEvents.description: Sanji turns to stone after seeing the legendary beauty of Princess Shirahoshi.
keyEvents.significance: Comedic moment emphasizing Shirahoshi's beauty and Sanji's character.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Crew Captured by Fish-Men
keyEvents.description: Local fish-men capture Luffy and his group, believing they're kidnapping Shirahoshi.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the tension and mistrust between humans and fish-men.

keyEvents.title: Vander Decken IX Confronts Shirahoshi
keyEvents.description: Vander Decken appears in person to confront Shirahoshi after years of threatening her from afar.
keyEvents.significance: Escalates the conflict between Decken and Shirahoshi to a direct confrontation.

keyEvents.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Hammer Debut
keyEvents.description: Luffy debuts his new Gear Second technique to defeat Vander Decken IX.
keyEvents.significance: First use of this technique, showcasing Luffy's post-timeskip combat abilities.

statusHistory.reason: Fish-Man Island remains an active location during the arc

description: The royal palace of Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and the royal family. An impressive structure located at the center of Fish-Man Island.

keyEvents.title: Nami and Camie Escape Ryugu Palace
keyEvents.description: Nami and Camie successfully escape from Ryugu Palace, with Hody Jones dismissing their escape as unimportant.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the reunion at the Sea Forest where Nami will confront Jinbe about Arlong.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Defeats Hody Jones
keyEvents.description: Zoro uses his Lion Strike technique to seemingly defeat Hody Jones at Ryugu Palace.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's post-timeskip strength and foreshadows Hody's reliance on Energy Steroids.

keyEvents.title: Neptune Recognizes Energy Steroids Threat
keyEvents.description: King Neptune shows concern about the Energy Steroids being a threat to Fish-Man Island's safety.
keyEvents.significance: Foreshadows the devastating effects the Energy Steroids will have later in the arc.

statusHistory.reason: Ryugu Palace is operational during this episode

description: A forest of sunken ships at the bottom of the sea near Fish-Man Island. The graveyard where Queen Otohime is buried and where Jinbe awaits the Straw Hats.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Head to Sea Forest
keyEvents.description: Luffy, Chopper, Hatchan, Sanji, and Shirahoshi escape on Megalo toward the Sea Forest.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the meeting with Jinbe where crucial backstory about Fish-Man Island will be revealed.

keyEvents.title: Nami Heads to Sea Forest
keyEvents.description: Nami asks Camie to take her to the Sea Forest so she can meet Jinbe and ask about his message.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up Nami's emotional confrontation with Jinbe about Arlong and the history between fish-men and humans.

statusHistory.reason: Sea Forest is the destination for multiple characters in this episode
